definition: to go bankrupt/to close down
to place upside down/to invert/to pour/to throw out/to move backwards/however/actually/as a matter of fact/contrary to expectation
to fall/to collapse/to lie horizontally/to overthrow/to fail/to go bankrupt/to change (trains or buses)/to move around/to resell at a profit
to close/to stop up/to shut/to obstruct

sentences.english: We also have acquired internet assets that are in liquidation or bankruptcy.
sentences.chinese: 我们也收购了一些已倒闭或破产的网络资产？

sentences.english: Some of the smaller players have already started to be weeded out.
sentences.chinese: 一些规模较小的商家已经开始倒闭。

sentences.english: The bubble has now burst and hedge funds will be decimated.
sentences.chinese: 现在，泡沫已经破灭了，对冲基金将开始大量倒闭。

sentences.english: It's a fact that thousands of companies go out of business every year.
sentences.chinese: 事实上每年都有数千家公司倒闭。

sentences.english: A sudden major increase in corporate use of fax machines nearly put this small company out of business.
sentences.chinese: 公司使用传真机的突增使这家小公司几近倒闭。

sentences.english: I lost my previous employment on account of close-down of the company.
sentences.chinese: 我失去先前的工作，是因为公司倒闭。

sentences.english: Mr Sengoku was also scathing about Japan’s habit of using public money to rescue bankrupt firms.
sentences.chinese: 由人先生还批评日本用公款救助行将倒闭公司的怪癖。

sentences.english: Several of the biggest banks failed during the depression.
sentences.chinese: 几家最大的银行在经济萧条期倒闭了。

sentences.english: Therefore , The Hong Kong-related enterprises will be paid in arrears or close down .
sentences.chinese: 因此，就会出现相关香港企业拖欠货款或倒闭的情况。

sentences.english: We can honestly say that we do not regret the demise of this muckraking paper.
sentences.chinese: 老实说我们不遗憾这八卦新闻报纸的倒闭。

sentences.english: An aluminum plant on the outskirts of the city closed last year.
sentences.chinese: 这个城市近郊的一家铝厂去年倒闭。

sentences.english: Sure, they’ve closed businesses, lost clients, and left relationships.
sentences.chinese: 当然，他们的企业倒闭，客户流失或众叛亲离。

sentences.english: We need to break up the too-big-to-fail banks;
sentences.chinese: 我们必须拆分这些庞大而不能倒闭的银行。

sentences.english: Former Wall Street darling Enron collapses in accounting scandal, filing for bankruptcy.
sentences.chinese: 前华尔街宠儿安然公司由于会计丑闻倒闭，宣告破产。

sentences.english: The director's mismanagement has accelerated the company's failure.
sentences.chinese: 主管者的管理不当加速了公司的倒闭。

sentences.english: 3 years later, this factory closed down, I began to set up temporary stalls.
sentences.chinese: 3年后，这家工厂倒闭了，于是我开始摆小摊子过活。

definition: to close down a business for good and put the best face on it (idiom)
to go bankrupt/to become impoverished/bankruptcy
to declare bankruptcy
to cease trading (temporarily or permanently)/to close down
(of a power plant, refinery etc) to shut down
to cut staff/to lay off employees
to close a door/to lock a door/(of a shop etc) to close (for the night, or permanently)
slack/in a slump
to come off sentry duty/to lay off (a worker)/laid-off
to close down (temporarily or permanently)/to go out of business
to call in a loan
credit crisis
to lose everything one invested (idiom)/to lose one's shirt
unemployment/to lose one's job
to travel on foot/(informal) to run off/to abscond
bad debt
